Text.Sent: I understand that this is late notice, but due to a change in my circumstances I was wondering whether it would still be possible to arrange a single graduate apartment in UTown for the summer term?

I will place in your housing application as my colleagues are in the midst of sorting out room assignments. There's still time, so let me know the estimated date of arrival and departure and I assume you would like to have single graduate apartment AIRCOM at UTown.
I will be arriving on Saturday, May 4, and moving on Saturday, August 4 to private accommodation.
In other words I will only be staying for the duration of the Summer Term.
I confirm that I wish to apply for the SGA in UTown.
My colleague has checked the rooms situation at UTown (UTown) - single non-aircon 4-bedroom apartment.
A tentative booking has been made for you. Do note that your room configuration may differs from the other 3 room-mates in the unit.
Please read through the information on UTown (ie. cooking not allowed, room configuration etc etc etc).
Please refer to the additional information below.
I appreciate if you could let me know your confirmed arrival date.
On NUS Housing, check­in out dates, please refer to: http://www.nus.edu.sg/osa/housing/General/Check_in_out_dates.html

Please note that if you choose to continue your stay at the GR@ UTown, you will be required to apply for the NUS Semester 1 housing when the application period opens for current student from 15 May to 21 May 2012.
Subsequently, you will also have to place in your online housing application for vacation period 1 and NUS Semester 2.
Please let me know if I should go ahead with your housing application at UTown. Please revert by Friday, 13 April 2012.
Please go ahead with the booking.
I will be arriving on Saturday May 5 and departing on Saturday August 4.
Thanks for arranging that, it's much appreciated.

Hi Angus, It’s very likely that the programme will assist to make the application and acceptance fee on your behalf. When registering at NUS Law, you can always pay us back then. Do you have the estimated time you will arrive in Singapore? May 5 is a Saturday and public holiday in Singapore. Please do read through the official housing offer on the check­ in procedures. Keep in touch. Warm regards, Silah
I see what you are saying about the check­in.
I have just reviewed my flight and I can change it so that I arrive on the 7th, i.e the Monday.
Would that make it easier from an administrative standpoint?

Hi Angus, Yes, it will make it easier (esp. about the deposit part) but we are doing this for other students, so it’s ok. The important thing is that you give yourself sufficient time to settle down. If you think that May 7 will still works for you, then just let me know. Warm regards, Silah
I feel confident enough about settling in, so I'll make it the 7th.
I'll arrive at the Residence on Monday the 7th of May at about 9am (my flight comes in early in the morning).
